alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Montgomery; Pulaski; Wythe (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freezing Fog Advisory issued January 13 at 9:24PM EST until January 14 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Visibility 1/2 mile or less in freezing fog. * WHERE...Wythe, Pulaski, Montgomery and Carroll Counties. * WHEN...Until 1 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility and potential frost on bridges, secondary roads, and sidewalks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Freezing fog can deposit a thin coating of ice on roads and sidewalks resulting in hazardous driving and walking conditions. Use extreme caution in these areas and assume that what you are seeing is ice not water.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. Also, be alert for frost on bridge decks and secondary less traveled roads resulting in slippery conditions. Untreated sidewalks and roadways are particularly susceptible to ice formation from freezing fog. Use extreme caution in these areas.
